peak.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the time when something or someone is best, greatest, highest, most successful etc
peak.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Sales this month have reached a new peak.
Most athletes reach their peak in their mid-20s.
He’s past his peak as a tennis player.
Oil production is down from its peak of two years ago.
the peaks and troughs of the US economy  (=high and low points)
The British Empire was at its peak in the mid 19th century.
Hotel rooms are difficult to find at the peak of the holiday season.
peak.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the sharply pointed top of a mountain
peak.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Mount McKinley is Alaska’s highest peak.
peak.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a part that forms a point above a surface or at the top of something
peak.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Whisk the egg whites until they form stiff peaks.
peak.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: the flat curved part of a cap that sticks out in front above your eyes
peak.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: the time when something or someone is best, greatest, highest, most successful etc
peak.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: The strawberry season is now at its peak.
By the next Olympics, she will be past her peak.
The traffic reaches a peak between 5 and 6 pm.
The company’s stock hit a peak of about $23.
Visitor numbers have fallen from a peak of 1.8 million per year to under 1 million.
Sales went through a number of peaks and troughs in the last fiscal year.
peak.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: All around are the spectacular mountain peaks of the Jungfrau region.
Mount McKinley is Alaska’s highest peak.
The snow-capped peaks of the Sorondo mountain range provide a dramatic backdrop.
At first all I could see was the hazy black outline of a jagged peak.
The Castle is situated on a rocky peak.
The mist cleared to reveal the distant peaks across the valley.
peak.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to reach the highest point or level
peak.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Sales peaked in August, then fell sharply.
Wind speeds peaked at 105 mph yesterday.
peak.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something
peak.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Gasoline prices are 14% below the peak level they hit in November.
a shampoo designed to keep your hair in peak condition
If you phone during the day you pay the peak rate for calls.
periods of peak demand for electricity
peak.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: the peak time or period is when the greatest number of people are doing the same thing, using the same service etc
peak.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Extra buses run at peak times.
Hotel prices rise during the peak season.
peak.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: the time when prices, shares etc have reached their highest point or level
peak.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The company’s share of overseas assets reached a peak two years ago.
It estimates that the value of its land is now 60 percent below its peak.
The number of cars produced fell from a peak of 800 in 2004 to 650 this year.
The FTSE 100 climbed to 2577.1, just below the intraday peak (=the highest point on a particular trading day) of 2580.1.
peak.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: the highest level etc something reaches
peak.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: Many Japanese investors bought property at peak prices just before values began to slump.
The company expects to hit peak production in two years’ time.
peak.translation[4].definitions[1].defin: the time when the greatest number of people in a country are doing the same thing, using the same service etc
peak.translation[4].definitions[1].examp: There are extra trains at peak times.
Hotel prices rise during the peak season.
peak.translation[5].definitions[0].defin: to reach the highest point or level
peak.translation[5].definitions[0].examp: The Bundesbank president declined to say whether German interest rates had peaked.
European metal dealers have been buying copper only as needed while waiting for prices to peak out.
Sources estimate that output from the oilfield will peak at about 25,000 barrels a day.
